intro: Geum calthifolium var. nipponicum, commonly known as Japanese avens, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It features basal leaves that are palmately lobed with a hairy underside, and its stems are usually hairy as well. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in late spring to early summer, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ornamental addition to gardens with suitable conditions.
